video_caption: The video begins with a white screen that transitions to a blue background featuring the League of Women Voters of Portland logo, surrounded by stars and stripes. The scene then shifts to a red background with a large star and the text "Video Voters' Guide ELECTION 2020 Candidate Portland City Commissioner Position 1 Alicia McCarthy." Following this, a woman with blonde hair, wearing glasses, a black jacket, and a maroon turtleneck, appears in a room with a blue vase of flowers and framed pictures on the wall. The text "LWV Colleen Shoemaker League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org" is displayed at the bottom of the screen. The video then shows a split-screen view of two women, one with blonde hair and the other with long brown hair, both in different rooms, with the same text at the bottom. The video concludes with a red background featuring the League of Women Voters of Portland logo and the text "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org."

The video features a split-screen interview between two individuals. On the left, a woman with short blonde hair, wearing glasses, a black blazer, and a maroon turtleneck, is seated in a room with a blue vase and framed pictures on the wall. On the right, a woman with long brown hair, dressed in a light blue blouse, is in a room with a white door and a television in the background. The video transitions to a close-up of the woman on the right, with a text overlay reading "LWV Alicia McCarthy Candidate Portland City Commissioner Position 1," indicating her candidacy for a city commissioner position. The video concludes with the woman on the right speaking, with the "MetroEast" logo appearing in the bottom right corner, suggesting the involvement of a media outlet. The setting remains consistent throughout, with both women appearing engaged in the conversation.

The video features a woman with long brown hair wearing a light blue blouse, seated in a room with beige walls and a white door frame in the background. She appears to be speaking directly to the camera, with her facial expressions and mouth movements indicating that she is engaged in a conversation or presentation. Throughout the video, a text overlay appears at the bottom of the screen, reading "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org," which suggests that the content is related to a guide for voters provided by the League of Women Voters of Portland. The logo of the League of Women Voters (LWV) is also visible in the bottom left corner of the screen, reinforcing the association with the organization. The woman's demeanor remains consistent, and the setting remains unchanged, creating a focused and informative atmosphere.

The video transitions to a close-up of the person on the right, with a text overlay at the bottom of the screen reading "LWV Alicia McCarthy Candidate Portland City Commissioner Position 1." The background remains consistent, showing a neutral-colored wall and a white door frame. The video maintains a professional and formal atmosphere, focusing on the conversation between the two individuals.

The video features a split-screen video call between two women, one with short blonde hair wearing a black blazer and a red turtleneck, and the other with long brown hair in a light blue blouse. The background of the first woman includes a blue vase with red berries and framed pictures, while the second woman is in a room with a white door and a television. The video transitions to a blue screen with white stars and text that reads "League of Women Voters of Portland Presents The Video Voters' Guide" and provides websites for more voter information. The final frames display a message reminding viewers to cast their ballots for the Primary Election on May 19th, along with the same websites. The video concludes with a thank you message to various foundations and organizations for their support, including the Multnomah Bar Foundation, Carol & Velma Saling Foundation, Vernier Software & Technology, and The Wyss Foundation.
